awd_titl_txt: Expedited Award for Novel Research:  New Laser-Based Method for Manufacturing High Temperature Superconducting Films
awd_abstract_narration: This project deals with a manufacturing technique for                      depositing thin films of high-temperature superconducting ceramic               materials of the type yttrium-barium-copper-oxygen compound.                    Deposition of the film will be done in a high-vacuum system.                    Elemental targets of the superconducting material will be                       sequentally evaporated from a rotating target holder using an                   Excimer laser.  The composition of the deposited film will be                   monitored and controlled in situ using a quartz resonator                       microbalance and a computer control.  Thin films of superconducting             materials have applications in the electronic and computer                      applications.
org_div_long_name: Division of Civil, Mechanical, and Manufacturing Innovation
